intro: Herniaria vulgaris var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy herniaria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and dry habitats. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and arranged in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
